intro: Stenopetalum lineare, commonly known as the slender-leaved stenopetalum, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its linear, narrow leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas. Stenopetalum lineare is often found in heathlands and is adapted to coastal conditions with high salt tolerance.
